chunks.text:
bGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=fuGpkKFiH%2BrOKrcdNLtWckaUZW0h644CyXWKRY0FO1A%3D&reserved=0> 	
	
Dear Clients,

We are writing to inform you about the container ship Maersk Saltoro, carrying 1,300 containers of Chilean cherries bound for China, experienced a main engine failure on January 13, 2025. This breakdown has significantly delayed the shipment, jeopardizing the timely delivery of the cherries before the Lunar New Year and causing economic concerns for Chilean exporters.

Maersk has confirmed the incident and is currently working on repairing the vessel. The company is keeping affected clients informed and aims to resume the journey as soon as possible. However, the delay in delivering the cherries could result in economic losses for Chilean exporters.

The Maersk Saltoro, built in 2015, is a large vessel with a capacity to carry nearly 10,000 containers. The breakdown occurred while sailing in the Pacific and the ship is now located in Micronesia’s exclusive economic zone.

This situation has raised concerns in the Chilean fruit export sector, as timely delivery is essential to maintain the quality of the cherries and meet the stringent requirements of the Chinese market.

BARBUSS our dedicated team of experts specializes in handling claims related to maritime incidents, ensuring a swift and efficient resolution process. Whether it's damage to cargo, delays, or other unforeseen circumstances, we have the expertise to guide you through the complexities of insurance claims and recovery.
